intro: Galium serpenticum subsp. malheurense, commonly known as the Malheur bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has slender stems that are often prostrate or ascending, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white flowers are clustered in dense umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps.
